explanation: Respondents could not find or allocate enough time for studying due to work, university, or other commitments.
The language was not required for their job or daily life, or they had no opportunities to use it.
Learners lost interest, felt bored, or lacked the internal drive to continue their studies.
Students felt they were not improving despite investing time and effort, which led to discouragement.
Negative experiences with teachers, boring classes, or ineffective learning materials caused them to stop.
Learning another foreign language became a higher priority than continuing with English.
Learners stopped because they did not have a specific, defined purpose for their studies.
